resources.string:
Copy your images to the configured storage location, then press the import stickers button. Your images will show up in the Gboard sticker list.

Have too many stickers to scroll through? Put your stickers in sub-directories, and we\'ll generate a new sticker tab for each.

Only PNG, JPG, GIF, BMP, and WebP files are supported. Any files or directories with a name starting with . are ignored.

1.5.0
Use Storage Access Framework to select sticker directory for Android Q compatibility. This also means you can now import stickers from an external SD card if you want.

1.4.4
Fixed crash if the configured sticker directory does not exist. Also reworded some text to be more understandable.

1.4.3
Fixed index refresh failing if you have a lot of stickers. Again.

1.4.2
Added support for WebP images.

1.4.1
Fixed a bug that caused the app to crash when requesting storage permissions on some phones.

1.4
Disabled the sneaky Firebase analytics that were enabled by default.

1.3
Added support for Android 4.4 through 6.0.

1.2
No longer fails if you have over 1000 stickers. Seriously though, why do you have over 1000 stickers?!

1.1
You can now search for stickers in Gboard! Keywords are generated from the sticker file and parent directory names.

1.0
Initial release.
Press after adding stickers or changing settings

Sticker import failed. Please copy the stacktrace below and submit an issue on GitHub with the stacktrace attached, along with a description of your setup. Thank you! 

 ---
Select a new directory to search for stickers
Please select the directory containing your stickers
